body.name: Yaheetech 14 Inch Twin Size Bed Frame Durable Metal Platform with Heavy Duty Steel Support Easy Assembly Non-Slip Mattress Foundation with Underbed Storage No Box Spring Needed Black Twin
deliveryMessages: $29.99 delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 8 mins.
features: 【Durable Frame】Made completely of durable steel framework, this twin size bed frame features solid slats and 6 thickened, rectangular support legs, bearing a maximum weight capacity of 450 lb, offering sufficient firmness and stability for your everyday quality sleep.

【Headboard Compatible】The reserved holes on the legs are made for you to effortlessly attach your favorite headboard. Make sure the holes are facing toward the bed head. Extra hardware for attachment is not included.
【Under-bed Storage】Ample 14 inch high space under the platform bed frame for keeping odds and ends, helping you build a tidy and organized under-bed space and maintaining the cleanliness of your bed.

【Noise Free & Anti-slip Design】The reinforced corner brackets effectively increase the structural stability and prevent squeaky noise. Additional anti-slip baffles on both sides prevent the mattress from sliding around.

【No Box Spring Needed】Durable steel slats are designed for replacing a bulky box spring, allowing you simply rest your latex mattress, memory foam or spring mattress on top and start your sweet dreams. The slats are spaced 5.3-5.5’’ apart.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Metal Platform Bed Frame with Heavy Duty Steel Slat Support / Non-slip Mattress Foundation / No Box Spring Needed / Underbed Storage Space The durability of the metal bed frame also prevents mattress sagging, which benefits the long-lasting use of your mattress. In addition, the high profile of the platform bed frame creates valuable under-bed space for storing your quilts, pillows, out-of-season clothing or other items, versatile for use. Ideal for guest rooms, bedrooms, spare rooms, apartments and dormitories.

Specifications of Metal Bed Frame Twin Color Matte Black Material Steel Overall Dimension 75’’ L × 40’’ W × 14.5’’ H Applicable Mattress Size 75’’ L × 39’’ W Max. Weight Capacity 353lb Slat Spacing 5.3-5.5'' Ground Clearance 12.6'' N.W. 31.42LB G.W. 34.17LB

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great bedframe and box spring replacement.
reviews.reviewText: I bought a smaller version of a all metal frame/foundation for myself years back and decided its time for my mother to get one too. I got this one so its higher up and is easier on her legs to get in and out of bed. Also her old frame was one of those fold up 2 piece frames with wheels, hers was bending and shifting the bed around.The frame was an absolute nightmare for us to put together, the instructions to not specify which way is IN or OUT or UP or DOWN it just shows "Part A connects to B" type of diagram. Ive had to take apart 2 pieces and swap them around because of this as it is built differently then mine which i ordered years prior.They give you a align wrench and a makeshift metal tube socket wrench with a pipe you insert into the center and use it to turn. Why do none of these products give you a hex-drill bit? I ended up ordering a 30 piece hex-bit set after this because it took us FOUR HOURS to put it together...The welds on the top and bottom covers for the legs only have 4 weld points in the center of each side. Making the welds break apart when your screwing in the bolts tightly. The threads do not have a point where the bolt reaches its fully tightened state so you can just keep twisting until it feels tight enough. 2 welds popped for me, but this isnt going to affect the use of it so its fine.The support beams/poles (8 of them, 4 on top 4 on bottom) do not screw in, they just set down into the anchor points. Even though the anchor points DO HAVE A HOLE for a screw or bolt, the instructions and poles do not have any screws, holes, or instructions to do so. So if you tried completing this frame and tilted it sideways to move all 8 of these poles would fall out.This frame cannot be bent, folded, or compactly stored in any way after assembly.The frame i bought is able to do all of this, the legs fold down, and the frame folds in half if we want to move it around.Seems to work good with foam mattresses. A 12 inch mattress was used with this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very supportive bed frame
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I love this heavy duty very sturdy twin bed frame. It saves space in a small room and it was also easy to set up. I like the height of the bed frame, you don't necessarily NEED a box spring to give it that support that you need, the supportive structure of the rod beams are very sturdy and strong. I would totally recommend this to my friends and family

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good material and high quality
reviews.reviewText: I received it on time with the reasonable price. This frame is so strong, reliable and high enough for large storage area under my bed. I would buy another for my son and recommend this item to everyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Took time to assemble
reviews.reviewText: Frame is nice and tall. Plenty of room under bed. Instructions are clear but tools provided are tiny. I struggled to assemble using them. Frame feels sturdy & quiet but does sway back and forth slightly when I get on the bed. I am going to go through and tighten screws to see if it helps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, well packaged with clear directions
reviews.reviewText: Bed frame arrived quickly, very well built, not bad to assemble without any special tools, package included extra nuts and bolts which I always appreciate and is definitely a sturdy piece. Buy if you need a good frame!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good solid frame
reviews.reviewText: I was very happy with this frame. The metal is solid, not flimsy. It was some work to assemble but luckily we had a cordless drill with the correct "Allen wrench" bit so that helped immensely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Twin Bed frame
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my teenage son who is now 18, he absolutely loves this bed frame. It’s very sturdy and reliable. It was also very affordable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive and sturdy, with design for headboard
reviews.reviewText: The frame is well design. very sturdy, with 6 pre-drilled holes for the purpose of installing headboard if you want. It is super cheap, no annoying noise. Tools are all provided. I like it. The cons is the assembly. There are quite a lot of screws, different types, about 25 of them. I don't know if the other bed frames are the same. However, the instruction is quite clear, just follow step by step. Be careful with the correct directions of the parts. You might need some WD40 to help you.
Avoid this one. It goes together alright but even when you torque up all the bolts it isn't sturdy. It also squeaks like crazy. Don't be sucked in by all the storage room, pick something else.
